com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.annotations.remoteObjects

Annotation Type IgnoreRemoteExceptions


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={METHOD,TYPE})
public @interface IgnoreRemoteExceptions
    Tells the JavaInvocationHandlerProducer to ignore all Exceptions that he received from the Remote-Source.

    Any Exception that should be thrown anyways can be marked by using the exceptTypes method.

    This Annotation exists mostly to ensure security, so that the Client does not receive an Exception, thrown by the server and therefor is able to see the Stacktrace of the Server.

    This Annotation has to be present at the requested class/interface, which should be proxied. So if the Client requests an RemoteObject via an interface, the interface has to declare this annotation at its Method.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<? extends Exception>[] exceptTypes
      With this method, you can declare, which Exceptions should be thrown.

    • Element Detail

      • exceptTypes

        public abstract Class<? extends Exception>[] exceptTypes
        With this method, you can declare, which Exceptions should be thrown.

        By Default, this Method returns an empty class array. You can add any class that is subclass of Exception to it, to signal that this Exception should be thrown anyways.

        Note: The thrown Exception will be encapsulated in an RemoteRequestException if it is'nt already.

        You may filter any Exception with that, but you cannot filter out the RemoteObjectNotRegisteredException. If you want to prohibit this, you should use RemoteObjectFactory.setFallback(Class, Runnable)

        Returns:
        an array of Exception Types, that should be thrown regardless of the provided Annotation
        Default:
        {}
